ticket.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string
ticket.original-body:
Today, I git pulled rails 2-3-stable and (inadvertently) updated rack to 1.0.0, therefore I can definitely tell who's at fault, it might even be me. Anyway, Rack::Request#media_type expects #content_type to return a string which it may not always do in its current incarnation. Below I've added in the tiny #to_s
ActionController::Request < Rack::Request @@@ ruby def content_type @content_type ||= begin if @env['CONTENT_TYPE'] =~ /^([^,\;]*)/ Mime::Type.lookup($1.strip.downcase).to_s else nil end end end @@@
This issue may affect other code at the intersection of ActionController and Rack. ActionController uses Mime::Type objects freely, but Rack doesn't know about them.
ticket.latest-body:
Today, I git pulled rails 2-3-stable and (inadvertently) updated rack to 1.0.0, therefore I can definitely tell who's at fault, it might even be me. Anyway, Rack::Request#media_type expects #content_type to return a string which it may not always do in its current incarnation. Below I've added in the tiny #to_s
ActionController::Request < Rack::Request @@@ ruby def content_type @content_type ||= begin if @env['CONTENT_TYPE'] =~ /^([^,\;]*)/ Mime::Type.lookup($1.strip.downcase).to_s else nil end end end @@@
This issue may affect other code at the intersection of ActionController and Rack. ActionController uses Mime::Type objects freely, but Rack doesn't know about them.
ticket.original-body-html:
Today, I git pulled rails 2-3-stable and (inadvertently) updated rack to 1.0.0, therefore I can definitely tell who's at fault, it might even be me. Anyway, Rack::Request#media_type expects #content_type to return a string which it may not always do in its current incarnation. Below I've added in the tiny #to_s

ActionController::Request < Rack::Request


    def content_type
      @content_type ||= begin
        if @env['CONTENT_TYPE'] =~ /^([^,\;]*)/
          Mime::Type.lookup($1.strip.downcase).to_s
        else
          nil
        end
      end
    end

This issue may affect other code at the intersection of ActionController and Rack. ActionController uses Mime::Type objects freely, but Rack doesn't know about them.

version.body:
Today, I git pulled rails 2-3-stable and (inadvertently) updated rack to 1.0.0, therefore I can definitely tell who's at fault, it might even be me. Anyway, Rack::Request#media_type expects #content_type to return a string which it may not always do in its current incarnation. Below I've added in the tiny #to_s
ActionController::Request < Rack::Request @@@ ruby def content_type @content_type ||= begin if @env['CONTENT_TYPE'] =~ /^([^,\;]*)/ Mime::Type.lookup($1.strip.downcase).to_s else nil end end end @@@
This issue may affect other code at the intersection of ActionController and Rack. ActionController uses Mime::Type objects freely, but Rack doesn't know about them.
version.body-html:
Today, I git pulled rails 2-3-stable and (inadvertently) updated rack to 1.0.0, therefore I can definitely tell who's at fault, it might even be me. Anyway, Rack::Request#media_type expects #content_type to return a string which it may not always do in its current incarnation. Below I've added in the tiny #to_s

ActionController::Request < Rack::Request


    def content_type
      @content_type ||= begin
        if @env['CONTENT_TYPE'] =~ /^([^,\;]*)/
          Mime::Type.lookup($1.strip.downcase).to_s
        else
          nil
        end
      end
    end

This issue may affect other code at the intersection of ActionController and Rack. ActionController uses Mime::Type objects freely, but Rack doesn't know about them.
version.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string

version.body:
I just found out that the solution isn't that easy. It just blows up in another place, namely in request verification where it is assumed that request.content_type is a Mime::Type
@@@ ruby def verifiable_request_format? !request.content_type.nil? && request.content_type.verify_request? end @@@
The easiest solution would be to have Rack call #to_s on whatever it gets from Rack::Request#content_type.
version.body-html:
I just found out that the solution isn't that easy. It just blows up in another place, namely in request verification where it is assumed that request.content_type is a Mime::Type


def verifiable_request_format?
  !request.content_type.nil? && request.content_type.verify_request?
end

The easiest solution would be to have Rack call #to_s on whatever it gets from Rack::Request#content_type.
version.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string

version.body: Is this still a problem if you pull 2-3-stable now? Bundled rack was just removed a couple of hours ago, and a few other changes to accommodate the Rack release. Just want to be sure before anyone goes digging.
version.body-html: Is this still a problem if you pull 2-3-stable now? Bundled rack was just removed a couple of hours ago, and a few other changes to accommodate the Rack release. Just want to be sure before anyone goes digging.
version.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string

version.body: That one bows up instantly as there are still references to ActionController::RewindableInput which doesn't exist anymore.
version.body-html: That one bows up instantly as there are still references to ActionController::RewindableInput which doesn't exist anymore.
version.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string

version.body: Looks like yours, Josh. Confirmed that AC is still attempting to autoload RewindableInput on 2-3-stable.
version.body-html: Looks like yours, Josh. Confirmed that AC is still attempting to autoload RewindableInput on 2-3-stable.
version.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string

version.body: These 2 patches fix the problem. Created against the 2-3-stable branch.
version.body-html: These 2 patches fix the problem. Created against the 2-3-stable branch.
version.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string

version.body:
This worked for me- modifying my code to match the patches did not .
(in initializers/mime_fix.rb) module Mime class Type def split(*args) to_s.split(*args) end end end
version.body-html:
This worked for me- modifying my code to match the patches did not .

(in initializers/mime_fix.rb) module Mime

class Type
  def split(*args)
    to_s.split(*args)
  end
end

end
version.title: AC::Request#content_type should return a string
